description:
Waabi, founded by AI pioneer and visionary Raquel Urtasun, is an AI company building the next generation of self-driving technology. With a world class team and an innovative approach that unleashes the power of AI to “drive” safely in the real world, Waabi is bringing the promise of self-driving closer to commercialization than ever before. Waabi is backed by best-in-class investors across the technology, logistics and the Canadian innovation ecosystem.

With offices in Toronto and San Francisco, Waabi is growing quickly and looking for diverse, innovative and collaborative candidates who want to impact the world in a positive way. To learn more visit: www.waabi.ai

You will...

Contribute and build the self-driving engineering foundations to develop the next generation autonomy software across several machine learning projects.
Be part of a team of multidisciplinary Engineers and Researchers using an AI-first approach to enable safe self-driving at scale.
Implement and improve machine learning training and inference pipelines.
Make iterations on the models for improvements.
Identify, propose and build infrastructure, data and computation pipelines, data storage strategies, common libraries and useful tools needed to optimize research and development of deep-learning models.

Qualifications:

MS/PhD or Bachelors degree with a minimum of 4 years of industry experience in Computer Science, Robotics and/or similar technical field(s) of study.
Solid coding proficiency in Python or C++.
Some experience in reading and developing production quality software, versus only creating prototypes/proof of concepts.
Experience in software architecture, system performance, latency and data flow.
Experience in Machine Learning.
Understanding of parallel machine learning training and model deployment (e.g., TensorRT conversion).
Ability to productionize machine learning models.
Experience building software solutions on cloud infrastructure.
Ability to rapidly prototype and test new algorithms.
Solid problem solving skills using linear algebra, geometry, statistics & probability.
Open-minded and collaborative team player with willingness to help others.
Passionate about self-driving technologies, solving hard problems, and creating innovative solutions.

Bonus/nice to have:

Experience designing and implementing tools for automated model tuning and hyper-parameter optimization, as well as experiment analysis.
Experience in Deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
Experience with automated testing.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.

The US yearly salary range for this role is: $122,000 - $190,000 USD in addition to competitive perks & benefits. Waabi (US) Inc.’s yearly salary ranges are determined based on several factors in accordance with the Company’s compensation practices. The salary base range is reflective of the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Note: The Company provides additional compensation for employees in this role, including equity incentive awards and an annual performance bonus.

Perks/Benefits:

Competitive compensation and equity awards.
Health and Wellness benefits encompassing Medical, Dental and Vision coverage (for full-time employees only).
Unlimited Vacation.
Flexible hours and Work from Home support.
Daily drinks, snacks and catered meals (when in office).
Regularly scheduled team building activities and social events both on-site, off-site & virtually.
As we grow, this list continues to evolve!

Title: Scientist (Molecular Biologist)
Location: Foster City, CA
Contract: 12 months (Contract with possible extension)
Pay Rate: $44.82-$48.27/HR w2

Job Description
The Pathobiology group is seeking a highly motivated scientist with experience in Genomics and Molecular Biology to join the Molecular Pathology group. A successful candidate will be instrumental in applying genomics technologies to tissue-based applications to derive molecular insights into disease biology. The individual will be responsible for refinement and execution of Spatial Transcriptomics, NGS/RNA-Seq on formalin fixed and/or frozen tissue. This role will interface cross-functionally across therapeutic areas and programs with Biologists, Pathologists and Data Scientists. Therefore, an ability to successfully engage and communicate across various functions within Research is essential.

Key Responsibilities
Primarily serving as the bench facing scientist in modification and execution of Spatial Transcriptomics/Emerging tissue-based technologies.
Execution of research projects that require gene expression analyses on fixed tissues.
Establishment of automated solutions for molecular biology readouts within a Pathology lab.
Cross-functional study planning, execution, and analysis with members in Biology and Research Data Sciences.

Knowledge, Experience and Skills
Demonstrated expertise of ways in which molecular biology principles could be applied to the interrogation of disease biology is required.
Extensive hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction, gene expression assays such as qRT-PCR is required. Prior experience with primer design and gene expression analysis is essential.
Experience with library preparation for next generation sequencing is highly preferred but not essential.
Ability to navigate genomics archives and databases hosted by UCSC, NCBI, ENSEMBL is essential.
Experience with tissue-based methods such as Immunohistochemistry (IHC)/Immunofluorescence (IF), in order to contextualize spatial relationships.
Demonstrated ability to communicate robustly and maintaining scientific rigor is essential.

Qualifications
A Masters degree in Genetics/ Molecular Biology/ Translational Biology or related discipline.
Proficient in execution of wide range of molecular biology assays.
Strong scientific background and in-depth understanding of genomic technologies. Prior experience with automation is preferred but not required.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills that reflect core values of integrity and excellence.

Required Years of Experience: 1-3

Required Degree or Certification: MS

Top 3 Required Skill Sets: Molecular Biology, RNA workflows, Sanger Sequencing

Top 3 Nice to Have Skill Sets: Probe/primer design, NGS library preparation, Previous experience with histology (IHC/H&E staining)
Unique Selling Point of this role: Access to cutting edge genomics techniques that integrate histology information

Role: Data Scientist

Location : Oakland, CA- Remote/Hybrid

Experience: 8-10 Year

Duration: 12+ Months

Technical Skills: AWS, pyspark, GIS tools like Arcmap, ArcGIS Pro, ETL and BI tools like Foundry/Tableau/Informatica

Job Description

" Have good experience in data analysis logic and preferably have worked in ETL and BI tools like Foundry/Tableau/Informatica.

" Sound knowledge in complex SQL statements.

" Comfortable in writing python scripts and use pyspark for data analysis.

" Hands-on experience in cloud computing (AWS) and has worked in Agile methodology.

" Should have a positive attitude to learn and deliver on project demand.

" Familiar and experience (preferred) in GIS tools like Arcmap, ArcGIS Pro etc.

" Good to have knowledge in electric distribution domain.

At Got It, Machine Learning Engineers and Scientists develop cutting edge technology and integrate it into our conversational AI platform. Our engineers bring fresh ideas from a diverse set of areas, including natural language processing, speech, and conversational AI, cloud computing, large-scale system design, security, artificial intelligence, UI design, and more. We need our team to be enthusiastic and versatile, display leadership, and take on problems across the full stack.

As a Lead ML engineer or a scientist, you would work with a fast paced team on mission critical R&D projects towards specific, and ever evolving, business goals. With your technical expertise, you would manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.

Minimum Requirements

Master's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related technical field
3 years+ domain expertise in NLP and deep learning
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Python, Java, or C/C++

Preferred Qualifications

Ph.D. with specialization in one of the following areas: NLP, Conversational AI or machine learning
5+ years of experience with one or more of the following: natural language processing, conversational AI, speech recognition, text understanding, classification, pattern recognition, recommendation systems, targeting systems, ranking systems or similar
Strong publication record
Strong software design and development skills and experience working effectively with science, data processing, and software engineering teams
Proven track record of innovation
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Experience with relevant technologies (e.g., PyTorch, Tensorflow, machine learning libraries)
Entrepreneurial spirit combined with strong architectural and problem solving skills

Founding Software Engineer
We are seeking a talented founding Machine Learning engineer to help us revolutionize the hardware ecosystem. This is a chance to join a small, well-funded founding team applying Large Language Models to a longstanding problem.
About the role:
As a founding engineer, you will design and build our core technology. You will work in a small team of 3 engineers directly with the CEO to understand our customers' needs and build the product.
You’ll be building the core product, and may have to learn new technologies or approaches on the fly. You’ll be able to shape your area of responsibility according to your interests.
You’ll talk to customers and integrate their feedback into the product.
As a high-growth startup, there will be an opportunity to expand your role as the company scales.
The work environment will be highly dynamic. Your role will be less structured and will involve ambiguity. There may be pivots, whose direction you’ll get to shape. You’ll have high degree of purpose, ownership, and responsibility over our product.
You will get firsthand experience building a startup. You’ll work closely with the CEO and customers and will often have direct access to investors.

Our Company

Research Scientist

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

Adobe Research is seeking a Research Scientist in computer graphics, computer vision and machine learning to join the Graphics and 3D Imaging Research organization with offices based in North America (San Jose, San Francisco and Seattle), London and Paris. This is an exciting opportunity to imagine and build the creative tools of the future! You will be working with a world-class team of research scientists and engineers to invent algorithms for hard research problems, and incorporate these algorithms into Adobe products, thus putting your work in the hands of millions of creative artists and designers. Our lab encourages publication of research ideas and supports collaborative research efforts with academic institutions. Our internship program provides an influx of new ideas, making our lab an exciting place for technical growth.

What You Will Do

Research problems in computer graphics, computer vision, and machine learning, with a focus on developing generative AI methods that connect vector graphics and raster images for content creation and editing.
Collaborate with other researchers at Adobe to invent state-of-the-art algorithms for these problems
Patent these algorithms and publish them at the premier computer graphics, vision and machine learning venues.
Build and iterate over functional prototypes of these algorithms
Collaborate with product groups to integrate these prototypes into Adobe's products.

What You Will Need To Succeed

Ph.D. in Computer Science or a related technical field, with a focus on computer graphics, computer vision and/or machine learning
Expertise in one or more of the following areas: generative models for content synthesis, deep neural networks, vector graphics, image processing
A strong personal research track record including peer-reviewed publications in top computer vision, graphics, and machine learning venues.
Strong Python and deep learning development skills and experience with one or more training or deployment environments (PyTorch, Tensorflow)
Experience with design of high-level APIs and frameworks
Expertise in optimizing and deploying machine learning models on device
Basic knowledge of C++
A passion for building creative tools with delightful user experiences
Strong verbal and written communication skills

Welcome expertise

Familiarity with 2D content creation tools (e.g., Illustrator, Photoshop, Lightroom, etc.)
Strong C++ development skills

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Who We Are:

We are a clinical stage company powering the next wave of genetic medicine through superior delivery with our next-generation lipid nanoparticle delivery platform. Our mRNA and gene editing therapeutics have the potential to directly replace or address underlying genetic mutations in a vast range of diseases starting with primary ciliary dyskinesia and cystic fibrosis. Our selective organ targeting (SORT) LNP platform is uniquely differentiated to enable the delivery of diverse genetic payloads to tissues beyond the liver.

At ReCode, we bring a unique blend of rigor, creativity, and curiosity to our high-hurdle mission. Our team is uniquely positioned to tackle this challenge, given our extensive experience in lipid nanoparticle delivery, mRNA design and optimization, mRNA manufacturing, gene editing, and rare disease drug development. We are a high performing, highly functional organization with a culture that is caring and strives to enable every member of our team to thrive.

Summary of Position:

We are seeking a hands-on, experienced, and visionary Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist to work as part of a highly collaborative, multi-disciplinary, and fast paced team. The objective of this team is to develop and apply machine learning (ML) models and data analysis tools across ReCode's proprietary lipid nanoparticle data sets to identify optimal LNPs and genetic payloads for better targeting. The successful candidate will develop and implement ML models as well as leverage data analysis and transformation tools to support clinical discovery and development across several cutting edge programs in the gene editing and mRNA therapeutics space.

The successful candidate must have a strong foundation in data science and experience in applying machine learning and deep learning models in either biotechnology fields, or fields with smaller but higher quality datasets. This position has significant visibility and potential for growth in a dynamic organization, as well as the opportunity to have a high impact in developing new clinical candidates.

Responsibilities:

Work with leadership to develop the vision and strategic plan for ReCode's machine learning platform, driving novel discoveries in RNA therapeutics.
Build data pipelines, and develop system and protocol for data warehousing across the organization
Develop and apply ML models to solve the needs and challenges specific to discovery and development of gene editing and RNA medicines.
Work with RNA biologists, the high throughput screening team, and the NGS team to acquire appropriate datasets to train, build, and refine machine learning models.
Utilize deep understanding of scientific literature and concepts to drive innovation for LNP design.
Ensure effective training and validation of large deep learning models at scale.
Partner across the organization to align data generation with infrastructure, innovative approaches, and data integration strategies.

Qualifications:

M.S. or Ph.D. (Ph.D. preferred) in data science machine learning, computer science, statistics, mathematical modeling, physics, computational biology, operations research, or related field
Strong experience in data science & machine learning required
Experience applying machine learning required
Proven ability to apply ML models to leverage smaller, but high quality datasets and deeply informed views on areas for potential creativity, and a high degree of flexibility in structuring models and workflows to adapt to experimental needs and data streams.
Demonstrated mastery of applying broad array machine learning techniques, including deep learning, and other approaches such as tree-based classifications, across a variety of ML architectures, data libraries, and cloud-computing development environments
Experience with applications in biotechnology, preferred

Salary Range: *150-175K

Please note that for remote positions, salary may be adjusted for cost of living

Benefits Offered:

No premium cost for employees - 100% subsidized by ReCode for full-time employees
Company 401k contribution
15 days of company paid holidays, including a holiday shutdown (usually the last week of the year)
Mental health support for employees & their families
FSA available, including a lifestyle spending account subsidized by company
Employee discounts at hotspots

ReCode Therapeutics (www.recodetx.com) offers a competitive compensation/benefits package with a friendly, collaborative culture that values employee engagement and ongoing career development.

ReCode Therapeutics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We'd love to hear from you if you like:

Making a big impact with a Forbes Top Startup Employer
Working on products that have traction (40X revenue growth in 4 years | #1 rated app in the insurance comparison category)
Solving problems in a huge market ($2T market size)
Working closely with serial entrepreneurs and seasoned leaders who have scaled companies like Robinhood, Amazon, LinkedIn, Wayfair, SoFi, Microsoft, etc.

About the opportunity:

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our central data team and partner with one of our emerging product groups. Helping everyday, hard working Americans save time and money on their cars and creating a world class experience is what drives every decision we make as a company. Since launching our mobile app in 2019, we have amassed over 4M customers, expanded our product offerings to multiple categories and scaled our team 10X. Our data team fuels all of our business and product decisions through delivering analytical insights and building advanced models.

Reporting to our VP of Business Operations and Analytics, you will leverage data to drive growth and retention for one of our emerging product groups (car maintenance marketplace or chatbot). You will perform analytical deep dives, develop and analyze experiments, build predictive models, and make recommendations that inform our product roadmap. Working with a brilliant team of product managers, product designers, software engineers, and key business leaders, you will play a big role in accelerating our growth and taking our customer experience to the next level.

How you will make an impact:

Partner closely with our product managers, software engineers, product designers, and key business leaders to drive user growth and retention for our core insurance product
Design, run, and analyze A/B experiments on new and existing features; extract key insights, share learnings and make recommendations on next steps
Build key reports, dashboards, and predictive models to monitor the performance of our insurance business, and communicate analytical outcomes to our teams
Transform and refine raw production data for analytical needs
Continually improve our data governance and data consistency standards within our database
Work with data engineering team on data tracking, integrity, and security as needed
Work with other data scientists to evolve, optimize and integrate machine learning models

Who you are:

Intellectually curious: You're not satisfied with surface level insights. You dive deep to understand how systems work, why people behave in certain ways and are intrinsically motivated to uncover root causes for issues or underlying reasons behind decisions.
Creative problem-solver: No challenge is too complex, no issue is too hard.
Data-driven: You're extremely analytical and live in data. At the same time, you're confident enough to make decisions when the data is limited.
Strong communicator: Able to drive alignment and communicate effectively to different audiences.

Ideal profile:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or a related discipline
2+ years of experience as a data scientist or product analyst in a consumer-facing web or mobile app environment
Experience designing and implementing A/B tests, and analyzing user experience
Hands-on experience with SQL (advanced proficiency)

About Jerry:

Jerry is America’s first and only AllCar™ app. We are redefining and radically improving how people manage owning a car, one of their most expensive and time-consuming assets.

Backed by artificial intelligence and machine learning, Jerry simplifies and automates owning and maintaining a car while providing personalized services for all car owners' needs. We spend every day innovating and improving our AI-powered app to provide the best possible experience for our customers. From car insurance and financing to maintenance and safety, Jerry does it all.

We are the #1 rated and most downloaded app in our category with a 4.7 star rating in the App Store. We have more than 4 million customers — and we’re just getting started.

Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $242 million in financing.

Join our team and work with passionate, curious and egoless people who love solving real-world problems. Help us build a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.

Do the best work of your career as a champion for small and mid-size businesses.

BILL is a leader in financial automation software for small and midsize businesses (SMBs). As a champion of SMBs, we are dedicated to automating the future of finance so businesses can thrive. Hundreds of thousands of businesses trust BILL solutions to manage financial workflows, including payables, receivables, and spend and expense management. With BILL, businesses are connected to a network of millions of members, so they can pay or get paid faster. Through our automated solutions, we help SMBs simplify and control their finances, so they can confidently manage their businesses, and succeed on their terms.

BILL is a trusted partner of leading U.S. financial institutions, accounting firms, and accounting software providers. We have operations in San Jose, CA, Draper, UT, Houston, TX and Sydney, AUS and are continuing to expand into other geographic locations. Make Your Impact Within a Rapidly Growing Fintech Company

This team supports the Cash In Cash Out organization, our largest product area covering automation of Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and Spend & Expense Management. job_title: Senior Data Scientist - Communication & Child Safety
description:
Every day, tens of millions of people come to Roblox to explore, create, play, learn, and connect with friends in 3D immersive digital experiences– all created by our global community of developers and creators.

At Roblox, we’re building the tools and platform that empower our community to bring any experience that they can imagine to life. Our vision is to reimagine the way people come together, from anywhere in the world, and on any device. We’re on a mission to connect a billion people with optimism and civility, and looking for amazing talent to help us get there.

A career at Roblox means you’ll be working to shape the future of human interaction, solving unique technical challenges at scale, and helping to create safer, more civil shared experiences for everyone.

WHY DATA SCIENCE & ANALYTICS?

The Data Science & Analytics organization's mission is to increase our speed, frequency, and acumen of making decisions at scale by instilling a data-influenced approach to building products. We cover a wide area of the data spectrum including analytical data engineering, product analytics, experimentation, causal inference, statistical modeling, and machine learning. Aligned and partnering with product verticals, we use this extensive tool belt to discover new opportunities and unmet use cases, influence and shape the product roadmap and prioritization, build data products and measure impact on our community of players and developers.

WHY TRUST & SAFETY - COMMUNICATION & CHILD SAFETY?

As a Senior Data Scientist in the Trust & Safety organization, you will drive one of Roblox's most important initiatives: Child Safety. With our large and growing number of active users on Roblox, safety and civility remains our #1 priority, and we are always working to ensure our community is protected. Child Safety aims to keep all communications within the Roblox platform safe and civil by detecting high-risk and challenging problems like bullying, predatory behavior, and child endangerment. Additionally, we operate at a massive scale processing billions of messages per day across different modalities like text and audio. You will also collaborate and report directly to the Director, of Data Science on the Safety team.

You Are

Passionate about data. You have the curiosity and enjoy learning new techniques and tools to extract value from data. You're up-to-date on the latest technologies across ML, AI, and data engineering, and are curious to learn more.
Excited about new challenges. You know how to pick the right tool for the scale and complexity of the problem and love architecting solutions to a diverse set of problems.
Engaged and insightful. You understand that analysis must be presented in meaningful ways and participate in spirited discussions about the findings. You are keen to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences and discuss appropriate tradeoffs.
Versatile. The problems we face in this area span a spectrum of products and technologies. You love working with big-picture data across multiple sources and can dive into a variety of technical setups with ease.

You Will

Accelerate product development through your understanding of the underlying data and your ability to partner with product and technical leaders to provide insights that lead to the safest experiences for Roblox's sizable user base.
Investigate new ways to efficiently discover communication on the Roblox platform that does not conform with our standards of safety and civility.
Develop modeling solutions to identify new behaviors and signals of malicious user behavior.
Collaborate with engineering teams to push detection systems toward real-time identification. Additionally, you will partner with trained qualitative investigators to surface the most relevant data while instilling safety and civility in our product decisions.

You Have

Bachelor or Advanced degree in Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, or other technical field
6+ years of industry experience OR 2+ years of academic experience in addition to 4+ years of industry experience
4+ years of experience applying statistics and analysis
4+ years of experience using big data query/processing languages such as SQL, Hive, or Spark to transform/manipulate very large datasets
4+ years of experience in one or more scripting languages such as Python or R
4+ years of industry experience in analytics focused on improving the experience and safety of communication products

For roles that are based at our headquarters in San Mateo, CA: The starting base pay for this position is as shown below. The actual base pay is dependent upon a variety of job-related factors such as professional background, training, work experience, location, business needs and market demand. Therefore, in some circumstances, the actual salary could fall outside of this expected range. This pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. All full-time employees are also eligible for equity compensation and for benefits.

Annual Salary Range

$295,490—$359,170 USD

You’ll Love

Industry-leading compensation package
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
A rewarding 401k program
Flexible vacation policy
Roflex - Flexible and supportive work policy
Roblox Admin badge for your avatar
At Roblox HQ:
Free catered lunches five times a week and several fully stocked kitchens with unlimited snacks
Onsite fitness center and fitness program credit
Annual CalTrain Go Pass

Roblox provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer | Contract to hire
description:
About Got It AI

Got It AI is transforming the human-to-human and human-to-machine conversational ecosystem by developing the world's first fully autonomous conversational AI system via leveraging state-of-the-art technologies. Got It AI, led by an experienced leadership team with a proven track record, is making a positive difference in a variety of industries, including education, finance, telecom, and e-commerce, by deploying multiple AI applications. We are looking for individuals who are enthusiastic about developing revolutionary technology while having fun.

About Role

At Got It, Machine Learning Engineers and Scientists develop cutting-edge technology and integrate it into our conversational AI platform. Our engineers and scientists bring fresh ideas from a diverse set of areas, including natural language processing, speech, and conversational AI, cloud computing, large-scale system design, artificial intelligence, and more. We need our team to be enthusiastic and versatile, display leadership, and take on problems across the full stack.

As an ML research engineer, you would work with a fast-paced team on mission-critical R&D projects toward specific, and ever-evolving, business goals. With your technical expertise, you will get the opportunity to work on state-of-the-art Conversational AI and NLP research such as Reinforcement Learning, Zero-shot, and Few-shot Learning, Transformers based large-scale Language Models, No Code AI, Language Understanding, Natural language generation, Information Retrieval, and Speech Recognition.

This is a contract-to-hire position.

Minimum Requirements

Master's degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent practical experience
Strong design and development skills and 3+ years of experience in the software industry
2+ years of experience with one or more of the following: Natural Language Processing, Conversational AI, Speech Recognition, Text Understanding, Classification, Pattern Recognition, Recommendation Systems, Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning, Ranking Systems, or similar
Experience with one or more general-purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Python, Java, or C/C++
Experience with relevant technologies (e.g., PyTorch, Tensorflow, machine learning libraries)
Experience working effectively with science, data processing, and software engineering teams
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Entrepreneurial spirit combined with strong architectural and problem-solving skills

Preferred Qualifications

Ph.D. or 4+ years of experience with specialization in one of the following areas: NLP, Conversational AI, or Machine Learning
Research Publications

Job Title - Scientist - Molecular Biology
Location - Foster City, CA
Duration 12 months contract
Description:

The Pathobiology group is seeking a highly motivated scientist with experience in Genomics and Molecular Biology to join the Molecular Pathology group. A successful candidate will be instrumental in applying genomics technologies to tissue-based applications to derive molecular insights into disease biology. The individual will be responsible for refinement and execution of Spatial Transcriptomics, NGS/RNA-Seq on formalin fixed and/or frozen tissue. This role will interface cross-functionally across therapeutic areas and programs with Biologists, Pathologists and Data Scientists. Therefore, an ability to successfully engage and communicate across various functions within Research is essential.
Key Responsibilities

• Primarily serving as the bench facing scientist in modification and execution of Spatial Transcriptomics/Emerging tissue-based technologies.
• Execution of research projects that require gene expression analyses on fixed tissues.
• Establishment of automated solutions for molecular biology readouts within a Pathology lab.
• Cross-functional study planning, execution, and analysis with members in Biology and Research Data Sciences.
Knowledge, Experience and Skills
• Demonstrated expertise of ways in which molecular biology principles could be applied to the interrogation of disease biology is required.
• Extensive hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction, gene expression assays such as qRT-PCR is required. Prior experience with primer design and gene expression analysis is essential.
• Experience with library preparation for next generation sequencing is highly preferred but not essential.
• Ability to navigate genomics archives and databases hosted by UCSC, NCBI, ENSEMBL is essential.
• Experience with tissue-based methods such as Immunohistochemistry (IHC)/Immunofluorescence (IF), in order to contextualize spatial relationships.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate robustly and maintaining scientific rigor is essential.
Qualifications
• A Master’s degree in Genetics/ Molecular Biology/ Translational Biology or related discipline.
• Proficient in execution of wide range of molecular biology assays.
• Strong scientific background and in-depth understanding of genomic technologies. Prior experience with automation is preferred but not required.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills that reflect core values of integrity and excellence.
Required Years of Experience: 1-3
Required Degree or Certification: MS
Top 3 Required Skill Sets: Molecular Biology, RNA workflows, Sanger Sequencing
Top 3 Nice to Have Skill Sets: Probe/primer design, NGS library preparation, Previous experience with histology (IHC/H&E staining)

Why you should join us:

At Sound Agriculture, we believe our food system can nourish consumers while benefiting farming communities and the planet. Through a deeper understanding of plant and microbial biology, we are leveraging the natural power of plants to make agriculture more agile and resilient. Our work focuses on developing nutrient efficiency products and modernizing plant breeding to improve the way we farm and the food we eat.

Sound is a Series D startup funded by leading investors in food and agriculture including Leaps by Bayer, Syngenta Group Ventures, S2G Ventures, BMO Impact Investment Fund, Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, Fall Line Capital, Cavallo Ventures, FootPrint Coalition and Northpond Ventures.

What you'll do:

We are looking for a Research Scientist - Sequencing to enhance our sequencing core team and implement new sequencing technologies to accelerate growth of our on-demand breeding platform and the development of our inputs pipeline. This position works closely with the Data Science & Technology team and across the Research department to test plant, microbial and soil samples, analyze sequencing, and design experiments. The Research Scientist - Sequencing onboards new sequencing technology to operationalize and scale-up existing sequencing workflows (e.g. implementing liquid handling automation, equipment, software tools, etc). This is an opportunity to help develop dramatically faster ways to deliver valuable agronomic traits and new inputs for crop efficiency.

The Research Scientist - Sequencing reports to the Sr. Director, Research and is based in our laboratory in Emeryville, California.

Compensation Target

$113,000 to $126,000 base salary, plus variable compensation bonus target of 10%

Bonuses are earned based on annual company and individual performance and are prorated based on start date.

Sound reserves the ability to adjust the compensation range based on the final candidate's experience, skillset, and geography. In addition to on target earnings, we offer above average equity grants for the industry as we believe that every employee should have a stake in the company's growth. If you're above this compensation target, we encourage you to reach out and discuss the entire package and opportunity before deciding not to pursue this position.

Responsibilities

Manage and mentor a team of junior researchers to execute sequencing workflows
Collaboratively implement, operationalize, and improve new & existing high-throughput sequencing workflows to advance our biochemistry platform
Characterize methylation patterns in genomic plant tissue samples and optimize workflow for new crops
Develop methods for library prep for multiple applications (e.g. WGS, methylation analysis, RNAseq, 16S rRNA, ITS sequencing)
Work with and optimize short and long-read sequencing technologies (including nanopore) for innovative applications
Develop and optimize gDNA extractions for various crops and soil samples
Oversee our sequencers, troubleshooting as needed
Work with Automation Engineering to develop protocols on automated liquid handlers for high throughput sample execution
Design and execute experiments to test hypotheses and mine scientific literature to guide experimental design
Use statistical analysis software to analyze datasets and communicate results to diverse audiences
Maintain safe practices in the laboratory
Promote a positive and inclusive work environment

Targeted Skills & Experience

A PhD, or equivalent experience with 1-2 years of relevant industrial experience in molecular biology, biochemistry, plant biology, microbiology, or related fields
Management experience is strongly preferred
Expertise using molecular biology techniques including: PCR, DNA and RNA extraction, RT-qPCR, and NGS
Competency using statistical tools to strengthen experimental design and enable data analysis (such as JMP, Spotfire, R or Python)
Experience with laboratory automation (such as Tecan, Beckman, Hamilton) to enable process scale-up
Understanding of plant genetics and gene regulation is preferred but not required
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proven track record of collaboration and teamwork in cross-disciplinary teams
Self-motivated and passionate about your work
Meticulous attention to detail and strong record keeping skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects and tasks
Meticulous attention to detail and strong record keeping skills
Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization, which requires flexibility and a willingness to learn new techniques and concepts

How this role demonstrates our core values:

Boldness: Is unafraid to expand the team's capabilities for sequencing, multiplexing, and analyzing beyond the current capacities. Explores our sequencing infrastructure and identifies pathways for building out our pipelines.
Ownership: Approaches each project with equal attention while balancing priorities of the different projects to generate a well flowing output of data. Takes pride in providing the highest quality data obtainable, regardless of how small the project.
Tenacity: Is deeply committed to the success of the organization bringing a solution oriented mindset to work everyday. Overcomes the many variables encountered with each project including incomplete genome data, multiple reference genomes, and genomic anomalies
Creativity: Cultivates strategies for obtaining new forms of data using the same sequencing infrastructure to enable inquiry of new hypotheses. Explores and advocates for new technologies to support a high throughput platform.

What we offer:

Opportunity to work in a disruptive startup with a talented, experienced, and growing team of dedicated individuals
Competitive total rewards package, including equity
Performance bonus structure or uncapped commission plan for sales positions
Comprehensive health care plans that include Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
Flex Spending Account (Healthcare, Dependent Care & Commuter Benefit)
401(k) with company match
Generous flexible paid time off
Paid parental leave
Mental health and wellbeing benefits
In-person and virtual events and engagement activities (we actually like hanging out with each other!) (e.g. First Fridays, Meditation, Potlucks, Cultural Events, Running and Climbing groups, Photo Contests, weekly Team lunch, etc.)

Sound Agriculture does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third party recruiting agencies responding to job postings. We will not respond to unsolicited requests to submit candidates.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We seek a diverse pool of applicants and consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, Veteran status, marital status, or any other protected status.

Sound participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the United States. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, Sound is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before Sound takes any action, including terminating your employment.

About This Featured Opportunity

Are you ready to embark on a thrilling journey at the forefront of technology innovation? Join us as we introduce you to an exciting role with endless possibilities. Advantis Global is committed to connecting individuals like you to highly coveted opportunities. Our client, a distinguished Fortune 500 company in the realm of technology solutions, is seeking a dynamic Research Assistant to join their Technology Engineering Camera Team who has extended experience on applying computer vision and machine learning for AR/VR applications. You'll work in a small and dynamic team to develop imaging technology for 3D scene understanding and recreate augmented reality to enrich human perception. Seize the opportunity to shape the future of technology with us!

THE OPPORTUNITY FOR YOU

Pioneering research, design, and development of cutting-edge computer vision and machine learning algorithms for light estimation and virtual object rendering.
Innovating and implementing applied color perception algorithms for camera and AR applications.
Spearheading the development of camera calibration and image processing algorithms to enhance imaging technology.
Facilitating the generation and processing of large datasets crucial for algorithm development in the realm of AI/ML.
Collaborating seamlessly with cross-functional teams, offering leadership and expertise for the development and productization of groundbreaking projects.
KEY SUCCESS FACTORS

A minimum of an MS/PhD degree in computer science, electrical engineering, imaging science, color science, physics, or a related field.
A track record of 3+ years of experience, including graduate school research, in the domains of computer vision and machine learning, particularly in the areas of light estimation and scene understanding.
Proficiency in 3D computer graphics, lighting, and shading, accompanied by coding skills in at least one of the following languages: Python, C/C++.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

A robust understanding of computer vision, machine learning, image processing, HDR imaging, image segmentation, depth estimation, human color perception, and AR/VR rendering.
Familiarity with light sensor, image sensor, camera, and display hardware systems.
Prior experience in optimizing algorithms for real-time performance on embedded systems.
Exceptional communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
BENEFITS

Company sponsored Health, Dental, and Vision coverage.

Join us in this transformative opportunity to be at the forefront of computer vision and machine learning development, contributing to the evolution of AR/MR technology. Your journey begins here, where you'll be an integral part of our mission to connect the world through cutting-edge technology.

#AGIT

job_title: Senior Research Associate or Associate Scientist, Cell Biology
description:
About the Company:
Unnatural Products is an integrated biotech company operating at the forefront of macrocyclic peptide drug discovery. Our mission is to leverage the potential of macrocyclic peptides to drug any protein target with small molecule-like pharmacokinetics.

UNP’s approach couples machine learning-based in silico tools with massively parallel peptide chemistry to enable the discovery and rapid optimization of highly non-natural macrocyclic peptides aimed at extracellular targets, undruggable intracellular oncology targets, and beyond. This strategy has enabled a fruitful ongoing collaboration with BridgeBio and has paved the way for additional upcoming academic and pharma partnerships.

Unnatural Products is a dynamic team of humble, brilliant, and hardworking scientists committed to changing the face of medicine. Based in Santa Cruz, CA we combine world-class science with a relaxed culture in a beautiful location. Come join us in shaping the future of biotech!

Role Summary:
This is an exciting opportunity to join our growing team spearheading novel therapeutic discovery. This position is for a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual that will become an integral member of the UNP Biology Team. The Biology team identifies and validates molecular targets, evaluates novel drug candidates, and provides forward-thinking approaches to advance our preclinical pipeline. A successful Senior Research Associate or Associate Scientist will independently design and conduct cellular assays to determine the activity and mechanism of action of macrocyclic inhibitors, and may also conduct experiments that validate potential targets. We are seeking a talented bench scientist that can work with a positive attitude in a dynamic, fast-paced, cross-functional team environment. This is a hands-on position for an experienced researcher who enjoys working at the bench.

Job Responsibilities:
Research, develop, and validate quantitative cell-based assays to address compound activity, selectivity, and mechanism of action.
Validate the role of biological targets in disease biology using genetic and pharmacological tools.
Support macrocycle hit and lead optimization efforts.
Be able to multitask and work autonomously across multiple projects.
Design, execute, analyze, and interpret experiments.
Support assay troubleshooting.
Train and mentor junior members of the organization.
Collaborate with the team to provide project-level updates and progress.
Learn new scientific skills as required by pipeline projects.
Collaborate closely with colleagues across scientific functions and departments, providing key scientific expertise and guidance in an interdisciplinary environment.
Keep complete and timely records in electronic lab notebooks.

Qualifications:
B.A./B.S. with +8 years of experience OR M.A./M.S. with +6 years of experience in a relevant discipline (e.g., Cancer Biology, Genetics, Molecular Biology).
Strong understanding of cell biology and various signal pathways.
Demonstrated extensive experience in mammalian cell culture; creating, optimizing and running cellular assays, and interrogating biological pathways using chemical biology tools.
Hands on experience in the use of genetic methods (CRISPR, shRNA, siRNA) for knock out or knock in of targets of interest in cell lines. Transfection, infection, and generation of transient and stable cell lines.
Experience with general cell and molecular biological techniques including proliferation/viability assays, HTRF, AlphaLISA, ELISA, reporters, proximity-based assays, Western blotting, immunoprecipitations, Flow Cytometry, cell stimulation, qPCR, molecular cloning, etc.
Highly organized and detail-oriented with excellent analytical, documentation and
multi-tasking skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate and interact well with colleagues, vendors, CROs, and scientific advisors.
Breadth and flexibility to adapt to changing project needs.
Strong problem-solving skills and a dedication to continuous learning and development.
Enthusiastic, self-motivated individual excited to work in a startup's fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Perks:
UNP employees enjoy numerous benefits including full healthcare coverage, 401k with employer contribution, flexible time off, continuing education stipends, weekly team lunches, charity matching, and more. Our offices and lab space is located in Santa Cruz, CA, and we are a short walk to the beach with world class surf or a hike in the beautiful redwoods. We are looking for people to join our team who share our passion for rigorous science, best practices engineering, and working in a fun, fast paced, and inclusive environment.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
Unnatural Products Inc. is a committed equal opportunity employer and evaluates job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

At Unnatural Products, we advocate for job titles that align with an individual's skill set, the impact they have on the organization, and the value they bring. We welcome applicants of varying levels of experience and recognize that responsibilities and job titles may be adjusted accordingly.

The expected salary range for fully qualified candidates applying for this role is $80,000 to $110,000. An individual’s position within the range is based on multiple factors, including education, relevant experience, and length of industry experience will influence the actual salary offered. Base salary of one part of the overall total rewards program, which includes the opportunity to participate in stock programs, performance-based bonus programs, and a competitive benefits package.

Min Hourly Rate($): 65.00
Max Hourly Rate($): 74.00

Title: Research Scientist III
Location- Onsite in Sunnyvale, CA
Duration: 12 months

Summary:

Color scientist
The client is currently seeking upcoming scientists and researchers with an interest in color sensing, color perception, and color management for AR/VR products.

Responsibilities:
• Develop ambient light sensor and color sensing technologies for consumer devices.
• Light sensor and image sensor data collection and analysis.
• Color perception research in augmented reality.
• Camera and display color calibration and characterization.
• Psychophysics experiments and user study on camera and display tuning
• Camera color processing modeling and analysis
• Heavy involvement in the initial product realization and bring-up.

Minimum Qualifications:
• B.S. Degree in Imaging Science, Color Science, Optics, Image Processing, Physics, or a related field.
• 3+ years experience (inclusive of graduate school research experience) in sensor characterization, human vision, imaging, or color science research and development.
• Knowledge of color and optical measurement methodology and metrics.
• Knowledge of camera and display system working principles.
• Experience programming in at least one of the following languages: Python, Matlab, C++/C#.

Preferred Qualifications
• MS/PhD in Imaging Science, Color Science, Optics, Image Processing, Vision, Physics, or a related field.
• Knowledge of human perception and color science.
• Understanding of light sensors, image sensors, cameras, and display hardware systems.
• Experience with camera image ISP and display processing pipeline and architecture.
• Experience with user study, human perception, and psychophysics experiment design.

Top 3 must-have HARD skills:
• Human perception study
• Image processing
• Camera calibration

Good to have skills:
• Color science
• Understanding of human color perception
• AR/VR app development
• Machine learning
• Computer graphics.

At Franklin Templeton, everything we do is focused on one thing – delivering better client outcomes. We do that by partnering closely with our clients, assessing their strategic needs, and identifying the solution or solutions that can meet the challenge. Over 9,500 employees working in 30 countries around the world are dedicated to servicing investment solutions for our clients in more than 155 countries. For more than 75 years our success has been a direct result of the talent, skills and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team.

The Opportunity

The FTT AI & Digital Transformation group is a newly established team within Franklin Templeton Technologies, the Technology function within Franklin Templeton Investments. The core mandate of this role is to bring innovative digital investment products and solutions to market leveraging a patented and innovative digital wealthtech/fintech product - Goals Optimization Engine (GOE) - built with several years of academic research in mathematical optimization, probability theory and AI techniques at its core.

The mandate also extends to leveraging cutting edge AI such as Generative AI in addition to Reactive AI to create value within various business functions within Franklin Templeton such as Investment Solutions, Portfolio Management, Sales & Distribution, Marketing, HR functions among others in a responsible and appropriate manner. The possibilities are limitless here and this would be a fantastic opportunity for self-motivated and driven professionals to make significant contributions to the organization and to themselves.

What are the ongoing responsibilities of the Sr. Research Scientist – AI & Optimization?

Innovation, Product Research, Proof of Concepts, Pseudocode & Design (30%):
Significantly contribute towards furthering the multi-year Goals Optimization Engine product road map. Conceptualize fitment against various industry use cases, create further product variants, design new features and enhancements across multiple distribution lines and geographies.
Be the SME for a particular sub-area/sub-domain within AI and/or Optimization and develop expertise in related areas/domains.
Create the pseudo code and working prototypes in a Python environment working very closely with the Product Managers and Product Developers.
Create well-articulated design documents and presentations to explain the research to internal and external stakeholders including clients and partners located globally.
Contribute towards industry research and evaluate partnerships with third party vendors and specialized service providers where appropriate.
Have a thorough understanding of boundary conditions (upstream and downstream) for the product, regulatory environments, data challenges, technology integrations, algorithmic dependencies and operational process related nuances so that nothing slips through the cracks.
Have an excellent understanding of the Investment Management industry, Financial Mathematics, Portfolio Construction and Portfolio Management nuances and keep oneself abreast with the latest in a fast-changing world.
Familiar with cloud computing environment, able to generate prototype on the platform and capable of communicating with engineers who are going to deploy the PoC.
IP creation, Paper writing and thought leadership: (20%):
Significantly contribute towards creating intellectual property of the highest quality that can be accepted in top tier academic and practitioner journals.
Peer-review the work of other research scientists and better the outcome of their research output.
Significantly contribute towards creating patent-worthy intellectual content and apply for patents and win them.
Significantly contribute for winning industry awards for superlative product research and innovative work products
Keep oneself abreast of the latest research happening in the industry and be able to evaluate it objectively and in an unbiased way.
Client Deployments, Product Development and Vendor Due diligence (50%):
Act as the SME in initial Client deployment discussions to show case the rigor of research, explain the product or solution concept, and to engage in discussions with similar individuals/teams from the client/partner side.
Significantly Contribute towards Product development for the modules and variants designed and researched by the person. This would be a key area for the Sr. Research Scientist.
Participate in discussions with third party vendors and potential integration partners to understand their capability, methodology, algorithm and perform rigorous due diligence and make unambiguous recommendations on Go – No Go decisions.
What ideal qualifications, skills & experience would help someone to be successful?

Education (or Equivalent Experience)
PhD in a relevant discipline (Optimization, Probability, Quant Finance, AI & ML, Computational Mathematics, Statistics et al)
Bachelors and master’s degree in STEM disciplines
Relevant industry certifications
Experience Core Skills
3-10 years of R&D experience in research departments of reputed organizations post PhD.
Demonstrated ability of creating intellectual content, paper publishing and patents.
Ability to connect the dots effectively between academia and practice. (Research need to be practical and implementable)
Exceptionally good mathematical skills.
Excellent Team player and demonstrate the ability to work in ambiguity and thrive in chaos.
Structured Thinking
Familiarity with deep reinforcement learning, dynamic programming and convex optimization is preferred.
Experience Other Soft Skills
Proven ability to take initiative and work under pressure in a changing/growing environment.
Exceptional decision-making skills: Ability to prioritize across needs given limited resources.
Thrives in a startup like environment: loves dealing with fast pace and changing needs.
Ability to create relationships both inside and outside of the Product organization.
Ability to narrate a story for problem along with the capacity to dive into minute details.
Superlative communication and consensus building skills.
Compensation Range: Along with base compensation, other compensation is offered such as a discretionary bonus, 401k plan, health insurance, and other perks. There are several factors taken into consideration in making compensation decisions including but not limited to location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. At Franklin Templeton, we apply a total reward philosophy where all aspects of compensation and benefits are taken into consideration in determining compensation. The salary, benefits and variable rewards will reflect the seniority of the position and a competitive market rate. We expect the salary for this position to range between $180,000 - $225,000.

#MID_SENIOR_LEVEL

What makes Franklin Templeton unique?

In addition to the dynamic and professional environment at Franklin Templeton, we strive to ensure that our employees have access to a competitive and valuable set of Total Rewards—the mix of both monetary and non-monetary rewards provided to you in recognition for your time, talents, efforts, and results.

Highlights Of Our Benefits Include
Three weeks paid time off the first year
Medical, dental and vision insurance
401(k) Retirement Plan with 85% company match on your pre-tax and/or Roth contributions, up to the IRS limits
Employee Stock Investment Program
Tuition Assistance Program
Purchase of company funds with no sales charge
We believe that being a good corporate citizen is good business. To us, corporate citizenship means being accountable, serving our clients, being an employer of choice, managing our environmental impact, and supporting our communities. An emphasis on corporate citizenship is embedded in our culture and values, and is an important element of how we achieve success.

We are also committed to your learning and development with resources focused around Experience, Exposure, and Education, to help you achieve your professional development goals.

Franklin Templeton is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity for all applicants and existing employees and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to ancestry, age, color, disability, genetic information, gender, gender identity, or gender expression, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation. We invite you to visit us at Franklin Templeton Careers to learn more about our company, career opportunities and recruitment process.

Franklin Templeton is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment. If you believe that you need an accommodation to search for, or apply for, one of our positions please send an email to accommodations@FranklinTempleton.com . In your email, please include the accommodation you are requesting and the job title and job number you are applying for. It may take up to three business days to receive a response to your request. Please note that only requests for accommodations will receive a response.

Base Pay Range: $107,500.00 - $182,800.00 Annually

Primary Location: USA-CA-Milpitas-KLA

KLA’s total rewards package for employees may also include participation in performance incentive programs and eligibility for additional benefits identified below. Interns are eligible for some of the benefits identified below. Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed above reflects the minimum and maximum pay for this position in the primary location identified in this posting. Actual pay depends on several factors, including location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education level or training. If applicable, your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Company Overview

KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.

Group/Division

With over 40 years of semiconductor process control experience, chipmakers around the globe rely on KLA to ensure that their fabs ramp next-generation devices to volume production quickly and cost-effectively. Enabling the movement towards advanced chip design, KLA's Global Products Group (GPG), which is responsible for creating all of KLA’s metrology and inspection products, is looking for the best and the brightest research scientist, software engineers, application development engineers, and senior product technology process engineers. The RAPID division is the world leading provider of reticle inspection solutions for the semiconductor industry. The company provides inspection solutions to both the mask shops and the semiconductor fabs to ensure that lithography yields are consistently high thus enabling cost-effective manufacturing.

Job Description/Preferred Qualifications

Responsible for supporting KLA's reticle inspection products.

Key Responsibilities include -

Product Development: Characterization of next generation state-of-the art semiconductor reticle inspection products. This includes designing test plans, collecting data, performing analysis, publishing results and recommendations in the form of applications notes and best known methods.
Customer support: Product value demonstration during beta testing, head-to-heads (H2H) and tools in the ramp phase, thereby enabling product penetration/adoption at customer facilities. This includes investigating semiconductor manufacturing yield issues and providing inspection solutions; creating & sharing product value statements and use-cases with engineering, marketing and sales groups; training customers and other applications engineers.
Use-case Demos: Conduct new tool demonstrations to showcase tool performance and develop use cases to help drive tool sales.
Worldwide travel (on average 10-20%) is required to support inspection products at customer sites.

Qualifications

Candidate must have MS or PhD in Engineering, Physics, Material Science, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related fields.
Ability to perform complex data/image analysis using combination of Excel, Matlab, Python, JMP or other data-analysis tools.
A background in Applications Engineering in IC processing/Semiconductor equipment strongly desirable.
A background in Systems Engineering, demonstrated by relevant coursework or work experience, is a plus. Systems Engineering implies multi-disciplinary knowledge-base (mechanical, electrical, optics theory, software)
Must have excellent communication, organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills. Candidate will be required to frequently present results to internal as well as external customers.
Candidate must be self-driven, and a strong team player.

Minimum Qualifications

Doctorate (Academic) or work experience of 0 years , Master's Level Degree or work experience of 2 years , Bachelor's Level Degree or work experience of 3 years

The company offers a total rewards package that is competitive and comprehensive including but not limited to the following: medical, dental, vision, life, and other voluntary benefits, 401(K) including company matching, employee stock purchase program (ESPP), student debt assistance, tuition reimbursement program, development and career growth opportunities and programs, financial planning benefits, wellness benefits including an employee assistance program (EAP), paid time off and paid company holidays, and family care and bonding leave.

KLA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by applicable law. We will ensure that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. job_title: Product Design Engineer (Imaging Base Signal, Electron Optics, Noise Reduction, Computational Tools) (E)
description:
Company Overview
KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.

Group/Division
With over 40 years of semiconductor process control experience, chipmakers around the globe rely on KLA to ensure that their fabs ramp next-generation devices to volume production quickly and cost-effectively. Enabling the movement towards advanced chip design, KLA's Global Products Group (GPG), which is responsible for creating all of KLA’s metrology and inspection products, is looking for the best and the brightest research scientist, software engineers, application development engineers, and senior product technology process engineers. The RAPID division is the world leading provider of reticle inspection solutions for the semiconductor industry. The company provides inspection solutions to both the mask shops and the semiconductor fabs to ensure that lithography yields are consistently high thus enabling cost-effective manufacturing.


Job Description/Preferred Qualifications
Product Design Engineers are core to KLA’s technology, while we do not currently have an opening, we are always building our world-class Product Design Engineer talent community within Reticle product division, we are interested in learning about your background.
Apply to this posting for Future Opportunities with KLA.
The successful candidate in this position will fulfil a critical role in supporting the design, and development of image processing algorithms that factor in physical artifacts, and that affect an advanced imaging system.
The mission is to understand the impact from artifacts of optical, mechanical, electronic or any other physical origin and how these affect the resulting image based signal. The successful candidate will be systems-oriented, and will work very closely with multiple functional teams such as the optics, mechanical, electronics, applications and software engineering groups.
The scope of activities will range from guiding the software teams in the development of state-of the art detection algorithms to image artifact troubleshooting efforts.
The successful pursuit of these activities will lead to optimized sensitivity for one of KLA's most advanced inspection systems.

Requirements:
Master’s degree + 3 years of work experience or a Bachelor's Degree + 5 years of work experience.
Prefer a BS or MS in Electrical Engineering (preferred focus on Signal Processing).
Multi-disciplinary Engineering experience with (medical devices, semiconductors, printing, or other).
Experience with analysis sources of noise – Spatial and Temporal.
Familiarity with computational tools. In particular, signal processing applied to images is a strong plus.
Scripting experience. Preferably in Python and in C
Ability to model, simulate and verify against empirical data or in driving empirical validation tests.
Multi-disciplinary vision is very important for this role. The candidate must be able to interact with the subsystem design engineering owners and map the relation of the noise budgets to the impact to the image signal.

Minimum Qualifications
Doctorate (Academic) Degree and 0 years related work experience; Master's Level Degree and related work experience of 3 years; Bachelor's Level Degree and related work experience of 5 years

The company offers a total rewards package that is competitive and comprehensive including but not limited to the following: medical, dental, vision, life, and other voluntary benefits, 401(K) including company matching, employee stock purchase program (ESPP), student debt assistance, tuition reimbursement program, development and career growth opportunities and programs, financial planning benefits, wellness benefits including an employee assistance program (EAP), paid time off and paid company holidays, and family care and bonding leave.

Title: Scientist - Molecular Biology
Location: Foster City, CA
Duration: 12 months

The Pathobiology group is seeking a highly motivated scientist with experience in Genomics and Molecular Biology to join the Molecular Pathology group. A successful candidate will be instrumental in applying genomics technologies to tissue-based applications to derive molecular insights into disease biology. The individual will be responsible for refinement and execution of Spatial Transcriptomics, NGS/RNA-Seq on formalin fixed and/or frozen tissue. This role will interface cross-functionally across therapeutic areas and programs with Biologists, Pathologists and Data Scientists. Therefore, an ability to successfully engage and communicate across various functions within Research is essential.
Key Responsibilities
• Primarily serving as the bench facing scientist in modification and execution of Spatial Transcriptomics/Emerging tissue-based technologies.
• Execution of research projects that require gene expression analyses on fixed tissues.
• Establishment of automated solutions for molecular biology readouts within a Pathology lab.
• Cross-functional study planning, execution, and analysis with members in Biology and Research Data Sciences.
Knowledge, Experience and Skills
• Demonstrated expertise of ways in which molecular biology principles could be applied to the interrogation of disease biology is required.
• Extensive hands-on experience with DNA/RNA extraction, gene expression assays such as qRT-PCR is required. Prior experience with primer design and gene expression analysis is essential.
• Experience with library preparation for next generation sequencing is highly preferred but not essential.
• Ability to navigate genomics archives and databases hosted by UCSC, NCBI, ENSEMBL is essential.
• Experience with tissue-based methods such as Immunohistochemistry (IHC)/Immunofluorescence (IF), in order to contextualize spatial relationships.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate robustly and maintaining scientific rigor is essential.
Qualifications
• A Master’s degree in Genetics/ Molecular Biology/ Translational Biology or related discipline.
• Proficient in execution of wide range of molecular biology assays.
• Strong scientific background and in-depth understanding of genomic technologies. Prior experience with automation is preferred but not required.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills that reflect core values of integrity and excellence.
Required Years of Experience: 1-3
Required Degree or Certification: MS
Top 3 Required Skill Sets: Molecular Biology, RNA workflows, Sanger Sequencing
Top 3 Nice to Have Skill Sets: Probe/primer design, NGS library preparation, Previous experience with histology (IHC/H&E staining)
